title: Pearson hit as American students leave textbooks on the shelves
text:
A slide in textbook sales in the United States that was twice as high as forecast has prompted Pearson to warn on profits once more.

The FTSE 100 educational publisher said on Thursday that the 20pc decline in demand from American university students would also put a return to sales growth next year in doubt.

The former owner of the Financial Times has repeatedly warned on profits in recent years and cut 16,000 jobs as it attempts to ready itself for the digital age.

Chief executive John Fallon said: "We thought that textbook sales would be down 10pc this year; it looks like now they're going to be down 20pc. That is painful for this year's guidance but what it means is we're just getting to...
